name: Damat - Tarık Akan 2016
description:
My works hold popular culture and personallities in social agenda;
these are public fıgures repsented ın my street art. When I’m depicting a public fıgure there
are specifıc mottos which are tied to them. It is very important to use these mottos together
whit the images to marry icon and motto to from one as art.

My artwork draws upon satirical and ironic notions;sometimes ıt ıs a means of adressıng the
ego of the fıgure ın a contoversıal manner. I often draw from western and eastern cultures and
theır respectıve ıcons and subsequent mottos.

The use of #ayna (Turkısh for mirror) is because when people look at my art, the images are
reflecting their life through socıal commentary. These images are on the walls as a motto and
as a life scene. Consequently, the impression of my art on people is to make them smile and
to subvert exıstıng notıons of the ıcon; to reflect on what ıs often unspoken.

#ayna never lies
